pullRequest.body:
We prove the following result:

> Let `s` be a bounded, measurable set of `Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñù` whose frontier has zero volume and let `F` be a 
> continuous function. Then the limit as `n ‚Üí ‚àû` of `‚àë F x / n ^ card Œπ`, where the sum is over the
> points in `s ‚à© n‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ (Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñ§)`, tends to the integral of `F` over `s`.

using Riemann integration. As a special case, we deduce that 

> The limit as `n ‚Üí ‚àû` of `card (s ‚à© n‚Åª¬π ‚Ä¢ (Œπ ‚Üí ‚Ñ§)) / n ^ card Œπ` tends to the volume of `s`.

Both of these statements are for a variable `n : ‚Ñï`. However, with the additional hypothesis: 
`x ‚Ä¢ s ‚äÜ y ‚Ä¢ s` whenever `0 < x ‚â§ y`, we generalize the previous statement to the real variable. 

This PR is part of the proof of the Analytic Class Number Formula.

---

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->
